pullrequest.title: middleware split: allResources becomes userResources and allResources

content.raw:
`cloudsim-sim` [uses](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/src/04b4ea0abe282fde5738d1e1e9b0238e49ca9de1/server/simulations.js?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#simulations.js-15) the `allResources` function, so as soon as cloudsim-grant is published, anyone building sim locally or creating a new ami would have it broken. I just made a [commit](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/commits/3e6a97afbec2dae94e25ee6e2b5177325adcacb6?at=default) directly to default so it uses version 0.1.3. 

I think that relying on people's memories to keep track of what may break what and what needs to be changed is prone to errors. We need a way to document this, but most importantly, to enforce this. I like using specific versions and I think it's a good start. Do you have any suggestions?
content.html:
cloudsim-sim uses the allResources function, so as soon as cloudsim-grant is published, anyone building sim locally or creating a new ami would have it broken. I just made a commit directly to default so it uses version 0.1.3.

I think that relying on people's memories to keep track of what may break what and what needs to be changed is prone to errors. We need a way to document this, but most importantly, to enforce this. I like using specific versions and I think it's a good start. Do you have any suggestions?
